isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING ROTORS - MOUNTING NEW ROTOR TO HUB

svcproc.title: MOUNTING NEW ROTOR TO HUB
svcproc.para: Clean the wheel hub and rotor mounting surfaces with a wire brush or coarse file. Make sure that all rust, paint, dirt, etc. is removed before assembling the components. Use a straight-edge across the mounting surface flange to make sure it is not bent.

Before installing a replacement rotor on the wheel hub, wash the rotor thoroughly with high grade denatured alcohol to remove all protective grease, oil or other residue. DO NOT use gasoline, mineral spirits or oil.

After installing wheel hub and rotor on vehicle, re-wash rotor braking surfaces with high grade denatured alcohol to remove all traces of grease, oil or other residue. DO NOT use gasoline, mineral spirits or oil.

For proper tightening sequence and torque values of wheel hub to rotor mounting bolts, refer to HUB TO ROTOR TORQUE REQUIREMENTS
. For wheel/rim mounting specifications, refer to GROUP 17-WHEELS, RIMS, AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
